text: Just by looking out over your lands is enough evidence to prove your worth as a leader. Your harvests are bountiful, your commoners safe and satisfied, your silos are fully stocked, and your guards are well rested. In a period of conflict, your territory is now famous as an island of tranquility.

Although no songs will yet hail you as being a champion of peace, you have much to show for your excellent governance. Farmers till their crops unmolested, and previously drained stockpiles begin to recover. The streets of your cities are orderly and your nobles content, but your strategists do advise you against a policy of complacency...

Trouble is brewing in your domain. Greedy warlords akin to snarling beasts snap at your borders, whilst unsatisfied and hungry citizens flee your towns to eke out their own living. Conflict is, sadly, inevitable, despite your perhaps naive wishes for diplomatic solutions. The generals in your court now have louder voices than your civil officials, as dark clouds begin to gather overhead.

The cost of war comes at a high price for your dominion. Your overstretched army can barely replace its losses, as the numbers of injured, the exhausted and mutinous mount up. Supplies are increasingly needed for military efforts, leading to essential foodstuffs being seized from your own farmers. As people grow hungrier, they grow angrier, and out of desperation they start to take their frustrations out on your regime. Within your inner circle, some advisors beg you to consider suing for peace, whilst other commanders openly blame your poor leadership for not being able to bring a swift end to the conflict. If something is not done with haste, disaster looms.

Just by walking your streets can the cost of your decisions be clearly seen. Beggars crowd every corner, many of them former soldiers too maimed to even return to their former occupations. Once bustling markets and taverns now lie deserted as more and more flee your towns for what they hope is a better life elsewhere. Those who remain are often sick, hungry or exhausted, or have resorted to banditry just to fill their bellies. Reports of cannibalism are everywhere, as are reports of families selling their own children for a handful of grain. Your shattered army can do little to protect your people, never mind guard your borders. History is poised to remember you as a harbinger of disaster, if your ruinious deeds are even worth the ink to record them.
[[b]]War Fatigue[[/b]] can be gained by battles, casualities, and war.
[[b]]War Fatigue[[/b]] can be lost by assignments and buildings.

As conflict spreads and peace is shattered, your people get increasingly weary, your soldiers grow exhausted, and the fields are neglected and left untilled. Seek peaceful and diplomatic solutions, lest your own retainers turn against you.
• Boosts population, public order, recruitment, when low
• Reduces population, public order, recruitment, when high
• Gained by being in wars, battles, and casualities

As conflict spreads and peace is shattered, your people get increasingly weary, your soldiers grow exhausted, and the fields are neglected and left untilled. Seek peaceful and diplomatic solutions, lest your own retainers turn against you.

As conflict spreads and peace is shattered, your people get increasingly weary, your soldiers grow exhausted, and the fields are neglected and left untilled. Seek peaceful and diplomatic solutions, lest your own retainers turn against you.

The military is the armour that protects the state, but even it can get chipped and damaged. Your aide will work to relieve the army's concerns. Aid and alms will be provided to veterans, land and food will be distributed to war widows and orphans. The concerns of the captains and generals will be taken into account, and fresh supplies and new equipment will be paid for to feed and rearm your weary troops.

Your adjutant presents a plan to offer support and relief to the needy populace under your protection. Funds will be raised to provide shelter for the homeless and poor, roads and bridges will be repaired, quarantines will be arranged to prevent the spread of disease, and emergency food supplies shall be distributed from your silos. Your people have suffered much hardship in your name, and is time to repay their faith.
